thig10.1:1.2: the sages have praised good friendship.
thig10.1:2.2: for that is how wisdom grows.
thig10.1:2.3: Should you associate with good people,
thig10.1:2.4: you would be freed from all suffering.
thig10.1:3.4: and so the four noble truths.”
thig10.1:4.2: explained the Buddha, <j>guide for those who wish to train,
thig10.1:4.3: ‘and for a co-wife it’s especially so.
thig10.1:5.1: some women even cut their own throat,
thig10.1:5.3: Being guilty of killing a person,
thig10.1:5.4: they undergo ruin both here and beyond.’”
thig10.1:6.1: “I was on the road and about to give birth.,
thig10.1:6.2: when I saw my husband dead.
thig10.1:6.3: I gave birth there on the road
thig10.1:6.4: before I’d reached my own house.
thig10.1:7.2: and on the road my husband lies dead—<j>oh woe is me!
thig10.1:7.4: all burning up on the same pyre.”
thig10.1:8.1: “Oh woe is you whose family is lost,
thig10.1:9.2: I saw my son’s flesh being eaten.
thig10.1:9.3: With my family destroyed, condemned by all,
thig10.1:9.4: and my husband dead, I realized the deathless.
thig10.1:10.1: I’ve developed the noble eightfold path
thig10.1:10.4: as seen in the mirror of the Dhamma.
thig10.1:11.2: laid down the burden, <j>and done what needed to be done.”
thig10.1:13.1: The Book of the Elevens is finished.
